intro: Erigeron australis, commonly known as the common blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as fields and roadsides, and it produces small blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it has a creeping growth habit with branching stems. Erigeron australis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support pollinators.
